Welcome to my homepage!

ME IN THE ACADEMIA

Since March 2020, I am working as a doctoral researcher in natural language processing (NLP) at the Cluster of Excellence "The Politics of Inequality", University of Konstanz. My current work is part of the project Framing Inequalities, where I focus on the automated detection of framing in political discourse using NLP approaches.

I received a master's degree in Speech and Language Processing (2019, with a focus on Natural Language Processing) and a master's degree in General Linguistics (2020, with a focus on formal semantics) from the University of Konstanz.

RESEARCH INTERESTS

Broadly, I am passionate about applying machine learning and statistical approaches to explore big data, especially text data. My interests include:

  • NLP applications in computational social science
  • Interpretability and analysis of large language models (LLMs)
  • Explainable artificial intelligence (XAI)
